alert.note: Alert for Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN PICKAWAY AND NORTH CENTRAL ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 606 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Logan Elm Village, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsport, Clarksburg, Pickaway County Airport, State Route 207 at US Route 22 and State Route 138 at US Route 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
